reasoning: Manic disorder (bipolar disorder with manic episodes) has similar epidemiology to bipolar depression. Incidence ~15 per 100k person-years, lifetime prevalence ~0.8%. Moderate confidence from population-based psychiatric surveys.
source: Merikangas KR et al. (2007). Lifetime and 12-month prevalence of bipolar spectrum disorder in the National Comorbidity Survey replication. Arch Gen Psychiatry. 64(5):543-552
